episodes.original_body:
Case: Clarence-Robinson-Dual-WC-MVA-06-10-2021
Client: Clarence Robinson

**DEFENSE ATTORNEY EMAIL CORRESPONDENCE COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW COMPLETED** - Completed systematic review of all defense attorney email correspondence from 2023-2025 using correct Gmail account. New search yielded 50+ emails providing complete case timeline. Defense attorneys identified: Morgan Salisbury (Lewis Brisbois - Lead), Mindy Stallmeyer, Denise Lonneman, Todd Gray, Jackie Snell, Mark Caloyer (Lewis Brisbois); Dan Scott, Aris Rogers (Morgan Akins - Tech Insurance Co.); Robin Joyce, Sarah Tussey (TN WC). CRITICAL DEVELOPMENTS: March 2025 - Dr. Nazar IME concluded plaintiff CANNOT RETURN TO WORK. August 2025 - WC lien RESOLVED AND PAID $17,000 to Tech Insurance Co. December 2, 2025 - Defense pressing for settlement response, trial January 2026. SETTLEMENT STATUS: Defense last offered $25,000 (February 2025), WC lien obstacle removed, strong medical evidence from Dr. Nazar. IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED: Client consultation on settlement offer, consider revised demand based on permanent disability finding. All correspondence documented in Defense-Attorney-Email-Summary.md file in case folder with complete timeline, attorney contacts, strategic analysis, and next steps.
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Clarence-Robinson-Dual-WC-MVA-06-10-2021. The client is Clarence Robinson. A comprehensive review of defense attorney email correspondence from 2023 through 2025 was completed using the correct Gmail account. A new search yielded 50+ emails, providing a complete timeline of the case. The defense attorneys identified include Morgan Salisbury (Lewis Brisbois – Lead), Mindy Stallmeyer, Denise Lonneman, Todd Gray, Jackie Snell, and Mark Caloyer (Lewis Brisbois); Dan Scott and Aris Rogers (Morgan Akins – Tech Insurance Co.); Robin Joyce and Sarah Tussey (TN WC).

Critical developments during this period include: in March 2025, Dr. Nazar, the independent medical examiner, concluded that the plaintiff cannot return to work. In August 2025, the workers’ compensation lien was resolved, with $17,000 paid to Tech Insurance Co. On December 2, 2025, defense counsel pressed for a settlement response, with trial anticipated for January 2026.

Settlement status shows that the last defense offer was $25,000 in February 2025. The WC lien obstacle has been removed, and there is strong medical evidence from Dr. Nazar supporting the claimant. Immediate action required is a client consultation regarding the settlement offer and consideration of a revised demand based on the permanent disability finding.

All correspondence is documented in the Defense-Attorney-Email-Summary.md file in the case folder, including a complete timeline, attorney contacts, strategic analysis, and next steps.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
